definition: to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech

sentences.english: Being too covetous for wealth is bad for one's health, particularly mental health.
sentences.chinese: 太貪求於財富不利於個人健康，尤其是心理健康。

sentences.english: The lust for gold spans all eras, races, and nationalities.
sentences.chinese: 對黃金的貪求不分時代，種族和民族。

sentences.english: I had met the Savior and nothing was getting between us.
sentences.chinese: 我已經遇到了救主，我不貪求什麼。

sentences.english: This created a craving for rich food.
sentences.chinese: 這讓他進而貪求豐美的食物。

definition: to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
to hear but not react (idiom); to turn a deaf ear/to ignore deliberately
harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others
to seek the cause in oneself rather than sb else
